article.headline: McNeese St. 60, Louisiana-Lafayette 58
article.story: LAKE CHARLES, La. -- C.J. Collins made two free throws with 4 seconds remaining to lift McNeese State to a 60-58 win over Louisiana-Lafayette on Saturday night. Patrick Richard led all scorers with 21 points for the Cowboys (2-4). The Ragin' Cajuns (1-3) erased a 56-44 Cowboys led with 3:16 to play. Randell Daigle, who scored 10 points, hit two free throws with 7 seconds to play to tied the score at 58. Tyren Johnson led the Ragin' Cajuns with 15 points and 13 rebounds. After Daigle's free throws tied the game, Collins took the inbounds pass and drove the length of the court before being fouled by the Ragin Cajuns' Lamar Robertson. The Cowboys shot 50 percent from the field (21-for-42) while Louisiana-Lafayette shot only 34 percent (18-for-53) from the field.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
